results.title: Notes on the Port of St. Francis
results.brief_description: A cinematic “poem” that straddles documentary and experimental traditions capturing the atmosphere of San Francisco. Shows fresh and unexpected scenes of the city and its people in addition to San Francisco’s landmarks. The narration, spoken by Vincent Price, is taken from a descriptive essay on San Francisco written in 1882 by Robert Louis Stevenson.

results.title: Notes on a triangle
results.creator_credit: Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In this short animation film the triangle achieves the distinction of principal dancer in a geometric ballet. The triangle is shown splitting into some three hundred transformations, dividing and sub-dividing with grace and symmetry to the music of a waltz. The film’s artist and animator is Rene Jodoin, whose credits include Dance Squared and several collaborations with Norman McLaren. Film without words.

results.title: Notes for a film about Donna and Gail
results.creator_credit: Don Owen, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of two young women who go to the city to work in a dress factory, and who share a room to ease their expenses and their loneliness. The film shows the currents that brought them together and the facets of their natures that first made them seem compatible but eventually drove them apart. Their story reflects, to a degree, the situation of anyone who has ever shared the life of another.

results.title: Not worth worrying about
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Journeys with Breast Cancer” Created in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia. ” I found a mass at the top of my breast. My doctor assured me it was nothing to worry about, I trusted his opinion.”

results.title: Not without Val
results.creator_credit: Vin Shelly, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vin Shelly has served the Shire of Chiltern for 20 years, and was shire president for three terms. He shares some of his interests over the years, as well as his main source of pride, the family farm.

results.title: Not without sight
results.creator_credit: Arthur Zigouras, Joshua Aronson and American Foundation for the Blind

results.title: Not without foundation
results.creator_credit: Andrew Sinclair and Country Roads Board
results.brief_description: Describes the investigation, design and construction of the piled foundations of the elevated structure of the West Gate Freeway, South Melbourne Section, with special emphasis on the new methods developed particularly for the rock upon which the West Gate Freeway structures will be founded, and which can be applied to any type of rock.
